dcterms:creator: Sean Trott
Benjamin Bergen
dcterms:description: RAW-C contains graded relatedness judgments (by human annotators) for ambiguous English words in distinct sentential contexts. Each ambiguous word has relatedness judgments for six different sentence pairs, with two same-sense pairs and four different-sense pairs, allowing for the evaluation of contextualized language models.
dcterms:title: RAW-C

dcterms:creator: Felix Hill
Roi Reichart
Anna Korhonen
dcterms:description: SimLex-999 is a dataset for evaluating semantic models with genuine similarity estimation, providing human judgments on the similarity of word pairs.
dcterms:title: SimLex-999

dcterms:creator: Daniela Gerz
Ivan Vulić
Felix Hill
Roi Reichart
Anna Korhonen
dcterms:description: SimVerb-3500 is a large-scale evaluation set of verb similarity, providing human judgments on the similarity of verb pairs.
dcterms:title: SimVerb-3500

dcterms:creator: Lev Finkelstein
Evgeniy Gabrilovich
Yossi Matias
Ehud Rivlin
Zach Solan
Gadi Wolfman
Eytan Ruppin
dcterms:description: WordSim-353 is a dataset containing human judgments of the similarity of word pairs, primarily used for evaluating the quality of semantic representations.
dcterms:title: WordSim-353

dcterms:creator: Guy Halawi
Gideon Dror
Evgeniy Gabrilovich
Yehuda Koren
dcterms:description: MTurk-771 is a dataset for large-scale learning of word relatedness with constraints, providing human judgments on the relatedness of word pairs.
dcterms:title: MTurk-771

dcterms:creator: Elia Bruni
Nam-Khanh Tran
Marco Baroni
dcterms:description: MEN is a dataset for multimodal distributional semantics, providing human judgments on the relatedness of word pairs.
dcterms:title: MEN

dcterms:creator: Eric H Huang
Richard Socher
Christopher D Manning
Andrew Y Ng
dcterms:description: Stanford Contextual Word Similarity (SCWS) is a dataset containing similarity judgments for word pairs in a sentence context, useful for evaluating contextualized word representations.
dcterms:title: Stanford Contextual Word Similarity (SCWS)

dcterms:creator: Mohammad Taher Pilehvar
Jose Camacho-Collados
dcterms:description: Word in Context (WiC) is a dataset for evaluating context-sensitive meaning representations, containing sentence pairs with an overlapping word labeled according to whether they correspond to the same or different senses.
dcterms:title: Word in Context (WiC)

dcterms:creator: Carlos Santos Armendariz
Matthew Purver
Senja Pollak
Nikola Ljubešić
Matej Ulčar
Ivan Vulić
Mohammad Taher Pilehvar
dcterms:description: CoSimLex is a dataset created for the Graded Word Similarity in Context (GWSC) task, containing graded similarity judgments for word pairs across multiple languages.
dcterms:title: CoSimLex

dcterms:creator: Janosch Haber
Massimo Poesio
dcterms:description: Dataset by Haber and Poesio (2020a) assesses polyseme sense similarity through co-predication acceptability and contextualized embedding distance.
dcterms:title: Dataset by Haber and Poesio (2020a)

dcterms:creator: Janosch Haber
Massimo Poesio
dcterms:description: Dataset by Haber and Poesio (2020b) focuses on word sense distance in human similarity judgments and contextualized word embeddings.
dcterms:title: Dataset by Haber and Poesio (2020b)
